National Public Lands Day
September 27 @ 9:00 am
-
11:00 am
ğŸŒ¿
National Public Lands Day at Mead Botanical Garden
ğŸŒ¿
Join us at
Mead Botanical Garden
on
Saturday, September 27, 2025, from 9:00 â€“ 11:00 AM
for a special morning celebrating
National Public Lands Day
. This nationwide event honors the beauty and importance of our shared public lands, and Mead Garden is the perfect place to connect with nature and community.
Enjoy a morning filled with free activities for all ages, including:
Yoga + Tai Chi
FREE sessions to refresh and restore
Self-guided nature tours
through the gardenâ€™s trails and habitats
Free Tree Giveaway
by the City of Winter Park Urban Forestry
Childrenâ€™s activities
designed to spark curiosity and fun
Winter Park Library Story Walk
for families to enjoy reading outdoors
Audubon Birds of Prey
presentation and more!
ğŸ“
Location:
Mead Botanical Garden, 1300 S. Denning Drive, Winter Park, FL 32789
ğŸŸ
Admission:
Free + Open to the Public
Come give back to nature, celebrate the outdoors, and discover the wonders of Mead Botanical Garden!

Ways to Support
Thank you for your interest in Mead Botanical Garden!
To create a thriving botanical garden in the 21st century, Mead Botanical Garden, Inc. has built a strong network of partners, volunteers, organizations, and donors. Their combined efforts have been instrumental in restoring Mead Botanical Garden. This section highlights the many ways to support Mead Botanical Garden, Inc., including raising funds for nature-based programming, The Young Natural Summer Camp, Â wellness and educational initiatives, Â and the ongoing operation and preservation of this vital green space.
Membership
Support the Garden with aÂ  â€œFriend of Mead Gardenâ€ Annual Membership.
Donate
Extraordinary things happen when you give to the Garden â€“ Donate Today
Volunteer
Join us as we restore, develop and sustain Mead Botanical Garden.

Mead Garden Membership Program
Take your support to the next level with a
â€œFriend of Mead Gardenâ€ Annual Membership. Your membership makes a difference! Membership support keeps the Garden lush and beautiful, funds new plantings and programs, provides essential organizational support, AND grants you access to member-only benefits.
Individual $50/year
Early program & event registration
Discounts on select programs & events year round
Subscription to the Mead Minute Newsletter
Free admission to 125 partner nature centers across America
Free admission & discounts with 300+ American Horticultural Society gardens nationwide
Sign Up

Sign Up
Join a special community of nature lovers.
Your membership helps in many ways:
Beautification and conservation initiatives
Wildlife habitat protection
Environmental education & wellness programs
Kids camps and field trips
Fun, family activities
Cultural events and more!
Thank you for supporting Mead Botanical Garden!
Your membership is valid for one year from date processed and is tax-deductible to the full extent allowed by law.
To join, complete and submit the form.
Please allow two weeks for your membership cards to arrive by mail.
For questions, contact us at
407-622-6323
or email
info@meadgarden.org
.
Fill out my LGL Form!

<< All Events
Tai Chi in the Garden
September 6 @ 10:30 am
-
11:30 am
A gentle exercise program that is composed of slow deliberate movements, meditation, and deep breathing to enhance health and well- being.
Join us for a unique experience to practice Tai Chi in the garden with Sifu Tony Garcia.
When:
Saturdays
Time:
10:30 â€“ 11:30 AM
Cost:
General Admission $15.00 | VIP Membership Discount $10.00 (ONLINE ONLY through Eventbrite)
All proceeds support Mead Botanical Garden, Inc. Non-profit 501(C)3
What to bring:
Water
Meeting location:
Please meet on the Grove Stage 10 minutes prior to start time. (Follow the shell stone path to the left of the public restrooms north to the Grove Stage.)
What is Tai Chi?
Tai Chi Chuan or tai chi, pronounced â€œtie chee,â€ is a gentle exercise program that is a part of Traditional Chinese Medicine. Tai Chi is derived from the martial arts and is composed of slow deliberate movements, meditation, and deep breathing which enhance physical health and emotional well-being.
Benefits
Tai Chi improves balance, agility, strength, flexibility, stamina, muscle tone, pain and coordination. This low-impact, weight-bearing exercise strengthens bones and can slow bone loss, thus preventing the development of osteoporosis.

<< All Events
Floridaâ€™s Hidden Invaders: Tackling Invasive Species
September 24 @ 12:00 pm
-
1:30 pm
Join us to learn about invasive flora and fauna in Florida! In this class, weâ€™ll define key terms like native, non-native, and invasive species. Youâ€™ll discover how these invasive species affect local plant and animal communities and learn to recognize common invasive species in the county and state. Weâ€™ll also discuss effective strategies to prevent their spread and protect Floridaâ€™s natural ecosystems. This class will be led by Clarissa Chairez, Master Gardener Volunteer Coordinator with UF/IFAS Extension Orange County. Clarissa is a horticulturalist and educator with a passion for sharing her knowledge and love of plants with others.
Topic:
Floridaâ€™s Hidden Invaders: Tackling Invasive Species
Speaker:
Clarissa Chairez, Master Gardener Volunteer Coordinator with UF/IFAS Extension Orange County
Date:
Wednesday, September 24, 2025
Doors open:
11:45 A.M.
Program Time:
12:00 â€“ 1:30 P.M.
Location:
Azaela Lodge, Mead Botanical Garden, 1300 S. Denning Drive Winter Park, FL
Cost: Free
Cancellation Policy:
Classes are subject to cancellation if a minimum number of attendees are not booked. If class is cancelled you will be notified by email. If you can no longer participate please reach out to Mead Botanical Garden so they can reopen your seat for another participant. Thank you.
Accessibility Policy:
The University of Florida is committed to providing universal access to all of our events. For disability accommodations such as sign language interpreters and listening devices, please contact Clarissa Chairez at clarissachairez@ufl.edu at least 2 weeks in advanced. Advance notice is necessary to arrange for some accessibility needs.
The University of Florida is an Equal Opportunity Institution

<< All Events
Young Naturalist Explorers: Twilight Bat Hike
October 4 @ 5:30 pm
-
7:00 pm
Join Mead Botanical Gardenâ€™s Young Naturalist Explorers class,
Saturday, October 4
, 2025 at 5:30 P.M. to learn all about bats!
Come get batty with us on October 4th at 5:30 pm for an interactive lesson on bats, followed by a twilight hike. In the barn we will have a variety of hands-on activities for participants to learn about bats and how scientists study them. Then at 6:30 an interpretive hike will begin, focusing on Florida bat species, where you can find them, and how to listen for them.
What to bring?
Red head lamp or Red flashlight
Close-toed walking shoes/boots
Weather-appropriate clothing
Water
Your sense of curiosity
*We recommend ages 5-12, but the family is welcome to tag along! Parents or guardians
must remain with their participants
for the duration of class.
Topic:
Twilight Bat Hike
Instructor:
Marcia Anderson
Date:
Saturday, October 4, 2025
Class Check-In:
5:15 P.M.
Class Start Time:
5:30 â€“ 7:00 P.M.
Location:
Discovery Barn, Mead Botanical Garden, 1300 S. Denning Drive Winter Park, FL
Cost:
$10

About
Mead Botanical Garden is a 48-acre urban oasis located in the heart of Orange County in beautiful Winter Park.
The Garden is OPEN DAILY from dawn until dusk and is FREE to the public.
Well-behaved dogs are welcome in most areas of the Garden provided they remain on a leash and that their owner picks up after them as needed.
Download our Garden Map

Programs

community gardening;
summer camps;
horticulture in the greenhouse;
guided bird walks,
classroom field trips, and more in the making.

Breathe with the Trees Relaxation Training
October 1 @ 10:00 am
-
11:00 am
WHEN
:
Wednesdays @ 10am-11am
LOCATION:
We start at the Yew Garden (shaded area next to the public restroom),
but
please be aware that our activities take us
to different locations through the hour.
Arriving on time will help ensure the best experience for all.
INSTRUCTOR:
Sarafaith Pekor, founder of
Seeds of Inclusion
, a community alliance of healthcare and horticulture professionals that specialize in wellness programs designed to enhance human health and to also increase human appreciation for the natural environment.
COST:
Please donate an amount of your choice â€“ 100% of your donation goes to support the work of Mead Botanical Garden. You can pay online through Eventbrite or use the QR code provided by the instructor.
WHAT TO BRING:
Bring water! We also recommend wearing loose, comfortable clothing and supportive, closed toed shoes that support your feet (sneakers ideal)
CLASS INTRODUCTION:
Stress may be an inescapable fact of life, but did you know that escaping into nature can be the perfect prescription for relieving stress?
Breathe with the Trees
is an enjoyable introduction to nature-based relaxation training. Participants will learn the practical magic of â€œgreen immersionâ€ through simple exercises that stimulate the senses, release endorphins, enhance mental clarity, neutralize anxiety, lift the weight of fatigue, and replenish the spirit.
WHAT ARE THE BENEFITS?
Nature based-relaxation training has been proven to help reduce the negative impacts of stress in the following ways:
Lowering cortisol (stress hormone) levels
Reducing blood pressure & heart rate
Relieving anxiety & depression
Restoring mental clarity and improving concentration
Neutralizing reactive anger responses
Relieving some symptoms of chronic pain
FUN FACT: Clinical studies show that relaxation exercises performed in tranquil outdoor settings get substantially better results in reducing stress than the same exercises performed indoors.
So why not treat yourself to an hour of tranquility and â€œgreen self-careâ€ at Mead Botanical Garden
?
All you have to lose is a little stress!

Tai Chi in the Garden
September 20 @ 10:30 am
-
11:30 am
A gentle exercise program that is composed of slow deliberate movements, meditation, and deep breathing to enhance health and well- being.
Join us for a unique experience to practice Tai Chi in the garden with Sifu Tony Garcia.
When:
Saturdays
Time:
10:30 â€“ 11:30 AM
Cost:
General Admission $15.00 | VIP Membership Discount $10.00 (ONLINE ONLY through Eventbrite)
All proceeds support Mead Botanical Garden, Inc. Non-profit 501(C)3
What to bring:
Water
Meeting location:
Please meet on the Grove Stage 10 minutes prior to start time. (Follow the shell stone path to the left of the public restrooms north to the Grove Stage.)
What is Tai Chi?
Tai Chi Chuan or tai chi, pronounced â€œtie chee,â€ is a gentle exercise program that is a part of Traditional Chinese Medicine. Tai Chi is derived from the martial arts and is composed of slow deliberate movements, meditation, and deep breathing which enhance physical health and emotional well-being.
Benefits
Tai Chi improves balance, agility, strength, flexibility, stamina, muscle tone, pain and coordination. This low-impact, weight-bearing exercise strengthens bones and can slow bone loss, thus preventing the development of osteoporosis.

Florida Vegetable Gardening
October 10 @ 2:00 pm
-
3:30 pm
Join us to learn how to grow vegetables this Fall. We will cover the basics, like finding the best location to build a garden, and advanced techniques like garden planning and transplants. After attending this class youâ€™ll have a practical guide that will help you grow delicious vegetables all season! This class will be led by Calvin Gardner, Urban Horticulture Agent with UF/IFAS Extension Orange County. Calvin is a horticulturalist and gardener who loves to grow vegetables year-round.
Topic:
Florida Vegetable Gardening
Speaker:
Calvin Gardner, Urban Horticulture Extension Agent UF / IFAS Extension Orange County
Date:
Friday, October 10, 2025
Doors open:
1:45 P.M.
Program Time:
2:00 â€“ 3:30 P.M.
Location:
Discovery Barn, Mead Botanical Garden, 1300 S. Denning Drive Winter Park, FL
Cost: Free
Cancellation Policy:
Classes are subject to cancellation if a minimum number of attendees are not booked. If class is cancelled you will be notified by email. If you can no longer participate please reach out to Mead Botanical Garden so they can reopen your seat for another participant. Thank you.
Accessibility Policy:
The University of Florida is committed to providing universal access to all of our events. For disability accommodations such as sign language interpreters and listening devices, please contact Calvin Gardner at cgardner1@ufl.edu at least 2 weeks in advanced. Advance notice is necessary to arrange for some accessibility needs.
The University of Florida is an Equal Opportunity Institution
